qas.question: What year was Contrasts written in?

context: In the early <b8_0>19th century<b8_0/>, <a0_0><b7_0>Augustus Welby Northmore Pugin<b7_0/><a0_0/> wrote <a2_0><b6_0>Contrasts<b6_0/><a2_0/> (<a1_0><a3_0>1836<a3_0/><a1_0/>) that, as the titled suggested, contrasted the <a4_0><b9_0>modern<b9_0/>, industrial world<a4_0/>, which he disparaged, with an idealized image of neo-medieval world. <a5_0><b10_0>Gothic<b10_0/><a5_0/> architecture, Pugin believed, was the only "true Christian form of architecture."
